I found the following in my log when using today's noon build:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2608)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2538)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:373)

org.eclipse.jface.text.AbstractInformationControlManager.install(AbstractInformationControlManager.java:347)

Created an attachment (id=7878)
Log file showing stack trace
This might be caused by the leak reported in bug 51866.

FWIW, I just got an identical error with 3.0m7/WindowsXP when trying to save a
.java file.  I'll attach the stack trace.

Actually, rather than an attachment I'll just paste in the log entry here. 
Also, I had left the computer for several hours and I think this was my first
save after the long break, though I could be wrong about that part.  Finally, I
noticed that Simon Tardell's "Resources" plugin is in the stack trace; it's
conceivable that it's the culprit and not Eclipse.

Laura, this is unrelated since it happens in a non-Eclipse SDK part
(se.tardell.simon.eclipse.resources.views.ResourcesView$3). I assume this part
posts some runnable asynchronous but when run doesn't check whether the widget
still exists.
Please mark as duplicate of Bug 52646.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 52646 ***
